content: Morning Ruby - Rohan's just had a London trip dropped on him. Flying out tomorrow night. Can we reshuffle the DEXA and make sure he's covered for the week?
Thanks Sarah, noted. I'll move the DEXA to the week after he's back and block it in his calendar. We'll build a UK travel protocol for him today.
UK trip noted, Rohan. All logistics handled. Your team's already on the travel optimisation protocol‚Äînutrition, circadian, mobility. Focus on your work; we've got this.
Perfect. Appreciate the speed on this üôè
Morning Rohan. Drafting the UK Travel Protocol v1.0. Framing it as our first live experiment in circadian reset. Will send the full schedule by afternoon.
Sounds interesting. Let's see how I handle the red-eye.

Protocol ready: Pre-flight‚Äîmax light exposure 10am-2pm tomorrow; caffeine cutoff 2pm. In-flight‚Äîskip heavy meals, hydrate every hour. Post-landing‚Äîget daylight 7-9am London time, 20-min brisk walk. Sending PDF to Ruby.
Got your London hotel info. Found 4 healthy spots within 10min walk‚Äîsending menus with my recommendations. Also prepped an airport/plane snack guide to keep inflammation low.
Quick one‚Äîsending a 5-min pre-flight stretch, in-flight ankle circles & thoracic twists every 90 mins, plus a 15-min hotel mobility workout for evenings.
All set‚Äîjust sent you the consolidated UK Travel Pack. Includes: Advik's schedule, Carla's food guide, Rachel's mobility plan. Let me know if anything's unclear.
Got it. Looks thorough. I'll try to stick to all of it.
Reminder: light exposure 10-2 today, caffeine cutoff at 2pm. Have a good prep day before your flight.
On it. Caffeine in hand now
That's your last coffee for the day üòä Hydrate and get some light before boarding.
Boarding now. Will try the stretches Rachel sent before takeoff.
Morning from Singapore‚Äîsafe landing? Remember daylight + brisk walk before breakfast.
Landed in London. Honestly feel less foggy than usual. Walk done, grabbing a light breakfast.
Love to hear that. That's your first early win.
How's lunch? Did you manage to find The Good Life Eatery near the office? Their salmon & quinoa bowl matches your macro targets.
Yes‚Äîgood pick. Didn't feel heavy afterwards.
Squeeze in the hotel mobility routine tonight‚Äîwill help with tomorrow's early start.
Done. Short but effective.
Sleep & HRV look steady on Oura despite travel üëè Keep following Advik's light schedule today.
Nice to see that. Jet lag feels under control.
Will run a comparison of your current HRV/sleep vs last UK trip. Hypothesis: ~15% improvement with this protocol.
Cool-curious to see that.
Day 3 HRV still above baseline. How's energy during meetings?
Honestly better than expected. Only dipped slightly after lunch yesterday.
That's the lower glycemic load working. Dinner suggestion: Leon's chicken super salad.
Alright, I'll hunt that down tonight.
Heading into the weekend, remember mobility before long meetings. Keeps back stiffness away.
Will do. Back feels surprisingly fine so far.
If weather's good, swap hotel gym for a 20-min park walk today, it'll be extra light + movement boost.
Blue skies, will take the walk.
Flight home tonight‚Äîfollow the reverse light/caffeine timing from your protocol. I'll book the DEXA for Thursday.
Got it. Thanks for lining it all up.
Boarded. Will do the stretches before takeoff again.
Nice. Same in-flight mobility every 90 mins. Hydrate and we'll see how you land.
This trip was definitely smoother. Thanks to all of you.
That's what we're here forüôå Safe flight back.
